p: From 1997 to 2017, 1593 cases of GBS were reported in the state of Rio de Janeiro (annual average, 60 cases). Analysis of monthly GBS cases determined that there were significant increases in GBS from 1 month to the next for 3 years (Farrington test P<0.001): in 2009 (n=115 cases) contemporaneous with the introduction of H1N1 9; in 2013 (n=85), which coincided with an epidemic of dengue virus type 4 10; and in 2015 with the arrival of Zika virus (n=326) (Fig. 3).
